body:
The first way gave this error

> Error: failed to register device: Post "https://api.jottacloud.com/auth/v1/register?device_id=rclone-44vt04llECptGXr3FwurU": read tcp 192.168.1.195:52037->185.179.129.36:443: wsarecv: En eksisterende forbindelse blev tvangsafbrudt af en ekstern vÃ¦rt.

Translated that means "An existing connection was forcibly terminated by a remote host."

```
$ curl "https://api.jottacloud.com/auth/v1/register?device_id=rclone-44vt04llECptGXr3FwurU"
curl: (56) Recv failure: Connection reset by peer
```

This looks like Jottacloud have firewalled this endpoint to stop people using it.

There is a bug in the No branch which is giving the `Reveal failed: input too short when revealing password - is it obscured` which can be fixed like this

```diff
--- a/backend/jottacloud/jottacloud.go
+++ b/backend/jottacloud/jottacloud.go
@@ -242,12 +242,12 @@ machines.`)
                authCode, _ := m.Get("auth_code")
 
                srv := rest.NewClient(fshttp.NewClient(ctx))
-               clientID, ok := m.Get(configClientID)
-               if !ok {
+               clientID, _ := m.Get(configClientID)
+               if clientID == "" {
                        clientID = legacyClientID
                }
-               clientSecret, ok := m.Get(configClientSecret)
-               if !ok {
+               clientSecret, _ := m.Get(configClientSecret)
+               if clientSecret == "" {
                        clientSecret = legacyEncryptedClientSecret
                }
 
```

But it ends up trying to access the same endpoint with exactly the same error

```
2025/09/25 11:30:11 NOTICE: Fatal error: failed to get oauth token: Post "https://api.jottacloud.com/auth/v1/token: ...: read: connection reset by peer
```

@albertony @buengese you've both worked on this bit of code - can you help?

As i wrote on the forum thread:

rclone legacy login for jottacloud is exactly what Elgiganten cloud/ElkjÃ¸p cloud used to login.

Elgiganten cloud do have sms authentication and 2FA app authentication, iâ€™m hoping someone can look into this and perhaps change some urls for authenticating (if itâ€™s that easy haha!) and add a dedicated option for logging in to both Elgiganten Cloud and ElkjÃ¸p cloud.

One or 2+ more dedicated cloud logins added to rclone then too! :smiley: Like they did with Telia, Tele sky, Tele2 etc.

I think Elgiganten Cloud /ElkjÃ¸p cloud would need 2 different logins because they are in different countries i would imagine there being different authentication urls etc? Donâ€™t know how many versions they have but i use Elgiganten Cloud the â€œSwedishâ€ one.

I think the Jottacloud legacy option can be removed completely after that or is there anything else that uses it at all?

edit: Once the logins for these 2 clouds are updated one should only need to do a "rclone config reconnect" command and select the new login options that has the right login information for these 2 clouds to be back up and running right?

issue.title: Jottacloud whitelabel authentication improvements

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

ElkjÃ¸p with all its subsidiaries have finally migrated their whitelabel services away from the legacy authentication method, and seem to be using OAuth 2.0 OpenAPI Connect in the same variant as Telia and Tele2 currently does.

This includes:
- ElkjÃ¸p Cloud (cloud.elkjop.no)
- Elgiganten Sweden (cloud.elgiganten.se)
- Elgiganten Denmark (cloud.elgiganten.dk)
- Giganti Cloud (cloud.gigantti.fi)
- ELKO Cloud (cloud.elko.is)

I also added a new whitelabel provider from the company MediaMarkt, called Let's Go Cloud (letsgo.jotta.cloud).

Adding all of these new alternatives to the config process in the same manner as Tele2 and Telia was implemented, would lead to a lot of clutter, both in code and in the configuration UX, in my opinion. I therefore decided to do some refactoring of the code, and restructuring of the configuration flow. This includes no longer hardcoding two complete URLs, representing the Authorization and Token endpoints, for each of these services. These are very similar for all of the whitelabel services, the domain name is the main difference. But also, I decided to not only centralize the generation of these URLs, but also to use the OpenID provider configuration endpoint to retrieve them. This should be at a well-known URL ending on `/.well-known/openid-configuration`, according to the OpenID standard. We already use such an endpoint for the standard authentication, although there the well-known URL are parsed from the login token.

The previous configuration flow included the following part:

```
Option config_type.
Select authentication type.
Choose a number from below, or type in an existing string value.
Press Enter for the default (standard).
   / Standard authentication.
 1 | Use this if you're a normal Jottacloud user.
   \ (standard)
   / Legacy authentication.
 2 | This is only required for certain whitelabel versions of Jottacloud and not recommended for normal users.
   \ (legacy)
   / Telia Cloud authentication.
 3 | Use this if you are using Telia Cloud.
   \ (telia)
   / Tele2 Cloud authentication.
 4 | Use this if you are using Tele2 Cloud.
   \ (tele2)
   / Onlime Cloud authentication.
 5 | Use this if you are using Onlime Cloud.
   \ (onlime)
```

This has now been replaced by the following, split into 2 steps:
```
Option config_type.
Select authentication type.
Choose a number from below, or type in an existing value of type string.
Press Enter for the default (standard).
   / Standard authentication.
 1 | Use this if you're a normal Jottacloud user.
   \ (standard)
   / Whitelabel authentication.
 2 | Use this if you are using the service offered by a third party such as Telia, Tele2, Onlime, ElkjÃ¸p, etc.
   \ (whitelabel)
   / Legacy authentication.
 3 | This is no longer supported by any known services and not recommended for normal users.
   \ (legacy)
config_type> 2

Option whitelabel_type.
Select whitelabel type.
Choose a number from below, or type in an existing value of type string.
Press Enter for the default (telia_se).
   / Telia Cloud authentication.
 1 | Use this if you are using Telia Cloud (Sweden).
   \ (telia_se)
   / Telia Sky authentication.
 2 | Use this if you are using Telia Sky (Norway).
   \ (telia_no)
   / Tele2 Cloud authentication.
 3 | Use this if you are using Tele2 Cloud.
   \ (tele2)
   / Onlime Cloud authentication.
 4 | Use this if you are using Onlime Cloud.
   \ (onlime)
   / ElkjÃ¸p Cloud authentication.
 5 | Use this if you are using ElkjÃ¸p Cloud (Norway).
   \ (elkjop)
   / Elgiganten Cloud authentication.
 6 | Use this if you are using Elgiganten Cloud (Sweden).
   \ (elgiganten_se)
   / Elgiganten Cloud authentication.
 7 | Use this if you are using Elgiganten Cloud (Denmark).
   \ (elgiganten_dk)
   / Giganti Cloud authentication.
 8 | Use this if you are using Giganti Cloud.
   \ (gigantti)
   / ELKO Cloud authentication.
 9 | Use this if you are using ELKO Cloud.
   \ (elko)
   / Let's Go Cloud authentication.
10 | Use this if you are using Let's Go Cloud.
   \ (letsgo)
whitelabel_type>
```
This PR also includes the fix suggested in https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8852#issuecomment-3333333963, for the `Reveal failed: input too short when revealing password - is it obscured` bug when using legacy authentication and answering `y` to the question `Do you want to create a machine specific API key?`.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Fixes #8852

https://forum.rclone.org/t/elkjop-cloud-config/52526

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
I took a stab at this with PR:
- https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/8855

Beta builds will be published here:
- https://beta.rclone.org/branch/jottacloud-config-fix/

I have tested that standard authentication still works, but have not tested any of the whitelabel authentications. If anyone are willing to test on beta builds that would be great! Report back which whitelabel provider was tested, if it worked, and if you have any other comments, e.g. to the changed config flow.

I'm not 100% completed, it is probably pretty close, but I need to have a fresh look at it tomorrow. In any case it would be good to know if the new authentication method is the correct one and will actually solve the problems with ElkjÃ¸p/Elgiganten etc.

Elgiganten Cloud works now! I could log in with no problems and reconnect to my mount that now works ðŸ‘

edit: i used the v1.72.0-beta.9126.85ec32265.jottacloud-config-fix/ and Elgiganten Cloud Swedish version

Testet on 1.72. beta jotta cloud fix with LetsGoCloud and get if its opens the browser:

`invalid_client - Client authentication failed (e.g., unknown client, no client authentication included, or unsupported authentication method). The requested OAuth 2.0 Client does not exist.`

It seems that the authentication is different: 
Here an example:
`
https://letsgo.jotta.cloud/auth/realms/letsgo/oauth2/auth?client_id=desktop-win&code_challenge=yZTVPLnGfdduWhRpYXNcQEqoeJyckkndRtZbVRhpucEgLkGHKFkgIzOlVfuMsbWt&code_challenge_method=plain&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A53682%2Fcallback&response_type=code&scope=offline_access%20offline%20openid&state=eftijxyfFIMsAoOFRPEvkOndQLnGxCmH
`

`[http://localhost:53682/callback?code=ory_ac_9hQnZWy91XQ54ayKNJSMlGqBcTJzzA6ECcUKy1PxNeE.V5L25pZMBIQkrzdh3LtHf4BZYd9rBa8byf8aEt8WDBg&scope=openid+offline_access&state=eftijxyfFIMsAoOFRPEvkOndQLnGxCmH](http://localhost:53840/callback?code=ory_ac_9hQnZWy91XQ54ayKNJSMlGqBcTJwqA6ECcUKy1PxNeE.V5L25pZMBIQkrzdh3LtHf4BZYd9rBa8byf8aEt8WDBg&scope=openid%2Boffline_access&state=eftijxyfFIMsAoOFRPEvkOndQLnGxCmH)`

> It seems that the authentication is different:
> Here an example:
> `https://letsgo.jotta.cloud/auth/realms/letsgo/oauth2/auth?client_id=desktop-win&code_challenge=yZTVPLnGfdduWhRpYXNcQEqoeJyckkndRtZbVRhpucEgLkGHKFkgIzOlVfuMsbWt&code_challenge_method=plain&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A53682%2Fcallback&response_type=code&scope=offline_access%20offline%20openid&state=eftijxyfFIMsAoOFRPEvkOndQLnGxCmH`

Where is that an example from? We use client_id `desktop` for whitelabel auth, but this indicates `desktop-win` was used, not sure if the issue now could be as simple as that..?

I pushed a beta build which changes the client_id for Let's Go Cloud, can you try that? It can be found here: https://beta.rclone.org/branch/jottacloud-config-fix/v1.72.0-beta.9130.a2ac11c99.jottacloud-config-fix/ (when build is finished).

> > It seems that the authentication is different:
> > Here an example:
> > `https://letsgo.jotta.cloud/auth/realms/letsgo/oauth2/auth?client_id=desktop-win&code_challenge=yZTVPLnGfdduWhRpYXNcQEqoeJyckkndRtZbVRhpucEgLkGHKFkgIzOlVfuMsbWt&code_challenge_method=plain&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A53682%2Fcallback&response_type=code&scope=offline_access%20offline%20openid&state=eftijxyfFIMsAoOFRPEvkOndQLnGxCmH`
> 
> Where is that an example from? We use client_id `desktop` for whitelabel auth, but this indicates `desktop-win` was used, not sure if the issue now could be as simple as that..?

Thank you @albertony ! 
I have this request response from the desktop client I installed on my windows pc to see how it works there.

REQUEST:
https://letsgo.jotta.cloud/auth/realms/letsgo/oauth2/auth?client_id=desktop-win&code_challenge=yZTVPLnGfdduWhRpYXNcQEqoeJyckkndRtZbVRhpucEgLkGHKFkgIzOlVfuMsbWt&code_challenge_method=plain&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A53682&response_type=code&scope=offline_access%20offline%20openid&state=eftijxyfFIMsAoOFRPEvkOndQLnGxCmH

RESPONSE:
[http://localhost:53682/?code=ory_ac_9hQnZWy91XQ54ayKNJSMlGqBcTJzzA6ECcUKy1PxNeE.V5L25pZMBIQkrzdh3LtHf4BZYd9rBa8byf8aEt8WDBg&scope=openid+offline_access&state=eftijxyfFIMsAoOFRPEvkOndQLnGxCmH]

I have a copy of the repo to test it - I now get the error "invalid_scope" thinks he donÂ´t like jotta-default that should be offline_access%20offline%20openid

Ok, good. Thanks for testing!

> I have a copy of the repo to test it - I now get the error "invalid_scope" thinks he donÂ´t like jotta-default that should be offline_access%20offline%20openid

Does this mean you are able to build rclone and experiment yourself, to find the necessary tweaks to get it to work?

> Ok, good. Thanks for testing!
> 
> > I have a copy of the repo to test it - I now get the error "invalid_scope" thinks he donÂ´t like jotta-default that should be offline_access%20offline%20openid
> 
> Does this mean you are able to build rclone and experiment yourself, to find the necessary tweaks to get it to work?

Yes, I can build it, but I have great respect for your source code. I dont feel ready to make tweaks to it.

> I have a copy of the repo to test it - I now get the error "invalid_scope" thinks he donÂ´t like jotta-default that should be offline_access%20offline%20openid

Good.. I can confirm that, from the openid configuration endpoint, that jotta-default is not a supported scope on this service:

```powershell
(Invoke-RestMethod https://letsgo.jotta.cloud/auth/realms/letsgo/.well-known/openid-configuration).scopes_supported
offline_access
offline
openid
```

While it is on all the others, which have a larger set of supported scopes:

```powershell
(Invoke-RestMethod https://cloud-auth.telia.se/auth/realms/telia_se/.well-known/openid-configuration).scopes_supported
openid
microprofile-jwt
roles
web-origins
jotta-default
profile
acr
phone
email
address
offline_access
```

I pushed another update, beta builds should end up here: https://beta.rclone.org/branch/jottacloud-config-fix/v1.72.0-beta.9129.fe1c03c80.jottacloud-config-fix/
Awesome work, @albertony â€” you nailed it!

Something happened with Elgiganten Cloud sweden since v1.72.0-beta.9126.85ec32265.jottacloud-config-fix/
I now get a problem loading page error in the web browser after logging in but the mount gets authenticated and works.
Is this because it's not done yet or did something change?
edit: With v1.72.0-beta.9126.85ec32265.jottacloud-config-fix/ version i did get a success in the web browser for Elgiganten Cloud sweden
edit2: New version i tried with the error was: v1.72.0-beta.9129.fe1c03c80.jottacloud-config-fix/

Unable to connect

Firefox canâ€™t establish a connection to the server at localhost:53682.
